subject: TONIGHT ON SHOWBIZ TONIGHT- CNN HEADLINE PRIME 11pm ET/ 11pm PT
body:
CNN.com - Showbiz Tonight










TONIGHT ON SHOWBIZ TONIGHT- CNN HEADLINE PRIME 11pm ET/ 11pm
PT

WILL PARIS HILTON GO TO JAIL?
Showbiz Tonight is in court waiting to hear whether Paris
Hilton will be sentenced to jail for getting caught twice
driving with a suspended license while on probation for a
drunk-driving charge. Plus: We've got the guy who has
started a
nationwide movement demanding Paris "Go Away!"

SHOCKING HASSELHOFF VIDEOTAPE!
David
Hasselhoff's shocking battle with booze!Tonight, new
developments surrounding the startling video of Hasselhoff
---
drunk, shirtless and lying on the floor! We've got the
surprising story of who shot the disturbing tape. Plus,
what
effect will this have on Hasselhoff's nasty divorce
and custody
battle? Showbiz Tonight with the "Knight
Rider's" drunken
nightmare!

BALDWIN VS.
BASINGER!
Tonight, Showbiz Tonight is right there as
the Alec Baldwin-Kim
Basinger divorce battle explodes -- in
court! Will Baldwin get
a shot at seeing his daughter again
after his absolutely awful
phone rant against here? Will
Basinger be held in contempt of
court? Showbiz Tonight has
the latest on the brutal
Baldwin-Basinger  brawl!

THIS WEEKEND ON SHOWBIZ TONIGHT AT 11pm ET/ 11pm PT

SATURDAY-To catch a sex predator!  It would
seem that
using TV shows to catch suspected predators would
be a good
thing. So why are some people criticizing the
stings? The
heated debate on TV's most provocative
entertainment news show.


SUNDAY-Inside the
minds of celebrity stalkers! As Sandra
Bullock takes
drastic action to protect her family from an
alleged
stalker, Showbiz Tonight reveals why celebrity stalkers
become so obsessed with stars and why they really are a
serious
danger.

SHOWBIZ TONIGHT QUESTION OF THE
DAY
Paris Hilton in court: Would she be better off in
jail?
VOTE AT CNN.COM/SHOWBIZ TONIGHT

SEND US A VIDEO EMAIL!
Send your response to
the Question Of The Day on video. Look
into your camera and
tell us what you think. Responses must be
no longer than 30
seconds. To send your video email, go to

"Showbiz
Tonight" at 
11 p.m. ET/PT on CNN Headline
Prime.
